dcterms:creator: B.B. Mandelbrot
dcterms:description: The Canonical Mandelbrot Cascade (CMC) is a historical archetype of multifractal measures, constructed based on an iterative split-and-multiply procedure on an interval, specifically using a 2D binary cascade with log-normal multipliers.
dcterms:title: Canonical Mandelbrot Cascade (CMC)

dcterms:creator: J. Barral
B. Mandelbrot
dcterms:description: The Compound Poisson Cascade (CPC) is designed to overcome limitations of the Canonical Mandelbrot Cascade, utilizing a Poisson random process for the localization of multipliers in the space-scale volume.
dcterms:title: Compound Poisson Cascade (CPC)

dcterms:creator: M.L. Stein
dcterms:description: Fractional Brownian motion (fBm) is a self-similar process characterized by its Gaussian nature, used for modeling various phenomena in image processing and analysis.
dcterms:title: Fractional Brownian motion (fBm)

dcterms:creator: D. Sheeren
M. Fauvel
S. Ladet
A. Jacquin
G. Bertoni
A. Gibon
dcterms:description: The hyperspectral datacube is used for mapping ash tree colonization in an agricultural mountain landscape, leveraging the potential of hyperspectral imagery for detailed analysis.
dcterms:title: Hyperspectral datacube
